course_title: Advanced Applied Methods in Social Epidemiology
class_notes: Pre-requisites of EPI 591S, EPI 550 or other modeling course or instructor permission. SDOH Certificate students, GLEPI/EPI MPH & MSPH, and EPI PHD priority registration until November 6.  All others may enroll on November 7.
course_description: Prerequisites: EPI Methods sequence (e.g. EPI 530, 540/545) and generalized linear regression modeling (e.g. EPI 550 or BSHES 532). This course introduces concepts and applications in several areas including the measurement of health inequalities, challenges to causal inference in social epidemiology, and multi-level thinking and analysis.
schedule_location: TF 1pm-2:20pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R226
sections: Class Nbr: 2726, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TF 1-2:20p, Instructor: Kramer/Mora, Status: Open
